Main.title: Logo
Main.content: Select an image for your main logo. Recommended format is svg.

Main.title: Logo 2
Main.content: The secondary logo is used on some menu variant like the transparent menu. Recommended format is svg.

Main.title: Favicon
Main.content: The small icon that appear at the top of the browser. Recommended format is png, recommended sizes are 64x64px.

Main.title: Font 1
Main.content: The main font family of the site. The fonts are provided by Google Fonts, you can preview the fonts from fonts.google.com.

Main.title: Font 2
Main.content: The secondary font family of the site.

Main.title: Icons
Main.content: The icons used on your site. For performance reasons you can load max one icons set.

Main.title: Color 1
Main.content: Primary color of the site.

Main.title: Color 2
Main.content: Secondary color.

Main.title: Color 3
Main.content: Additional color.

Layout.title: Page width
Layout.content: The overall maximum width of the site.

Layout.title: Vertical section space
Layout.content: The top and bottom padding between each section of the pages.

Layout.title: Mobile vertical section space
Layout.content: The top and bottom padding between each section of the pages. Applied only on mobile devices.

Layout.title: Vertical columns space
Layout.content: The top and bottom padding of the columns.

Layout.title: RTL
Layout.content: Enable the right to left layout.

Main.title: Menu type
Main.content: The site primary menu.

Main.title: Menu height
Main.content: The site menu height.

Main.title: Dropdown animation
Main.content: The animation on hover of the dropdown sub menu.

Main.title: Menu position
Main.content: Menu position. This setting is supported only by horizontal menu types.

Main.title: Transparent menu
Main.content: Make the menu look transparent. For dark backgrounds you may want to add the class 'light' to the menu. You can add it from the 'Custom css classes' setting below.

Main.title: Wide menu
Main.content: Enlarge the menu and make it full width. This setting is supported only by horizontal menu types.

Main.title: One page menu
Main.content: Activate this setting if your site is one page and all the menu items link to different parts of the same page.

Main.title: Fixed top menu
Main.content: Show the menu always on top. This setting is supported only by horizontal menu types.

Main.title: Search bar
Main.content: Display the menu search bar.

Main.title: Search button
Main.content: Display the menu search button.

Main.title: Social icons
Main.content: Display the social icons on the menu. Set the social icons links from the 'Social' settings area.

Main.title: Shopping cart
Main.content: Display the shipping cart. This setting require Woocommerce plugin.

Main.title: Languages menu
Main.content: Display the languages menu. This setting require WPML plugin or Polylang plugin.

Main.title: CSS classes
Main.content: Add custom css classes to the menu by insert here the classes names, separated by spaces.

Custom.title: Custom area
Custom.content: Insert here the HTML code for the custom area content. You can use all the code snippets and code examples of themekit.dev/docs/html/.

Custom.title: Big box area
Custom.content: Insert here the HTML code for the box of the big box menu type. You can use all the code snippets and code examples of themekit.dev/docs/html/.

Top menu.title: Active
Top menu.content: Enable or disable the top menu. You can add the menu items from the Menu WordPress page.

Top menu.title: Hide on scroll
Top menu.content: Hide the top menu on page scroll.

Top menu.title: Search bar
Top menu.content: Display the top menu search bar.

Top menu.title: Social icons
Top menu.content: Display the social icons on the top menu. Set the social icons links from the 'Social' settings area.

Top menu.title: Languages menu
Top menu.content: Display the languages menu on the top menu. This setting require WPML plugin or Polylang plugin.

Footer.title: Wide footer
Footer.content: Enlarge the footer and make it full width.

Footer.title: Columns and layout
Footer.content: Set the footer layout and the number of columns. The layout is based on the Bootstrap Grid System.

Footer.title: Scroll top
Footer.content: Display the scroll to top button.

Footer.title: Social icons
Footer.content: Display the social icons on the footer. Set the social icons links from the 'Social' settings area.

Footer.title: Social icons position
Footer.content: Set where to display the social icons.

Footer.title: Menu
Footer.content: Enable or disable the footer menu. You can add the menu items from the Menu WordPress page.

Footer.title: Menu position
Footer.content: Set where to display the footer menu.

Footer.title: CSS classes
Footer.content: Add custom css classes to the footer by insert here the classes names, separated by spaces.

Footer.title: Vertical footer space
Footer.content: The top and bottom padding of the footer.

Footer.title: Contents alignment
Footer.content: Set the alignment of the footer contents.

Footer.title: Column 1
Footer.content: Insert here the HTML code for the first footer column. You can use all the code snippets and code examples of themekit.dev/docs/html/.

Footer.title: Column 2
Footer.content: Insert here the HTML code for the second footer column.

Footer.title: Column 3
Footer.content: Insert here the HTML code for the third footer column. This column is not displayed for the '6-6' layout.

Footer.title: Column 4
Footer.content: Insert here the HTML code for the fourth footer column. This column is displayed only with the '3-3-3-3' layout.

Footer.title: Copyright
Footer.content: The text displayed at the bottom of the footer.

Customizations.title: CSS
Customizations.content: Insert here the custom css code, it will be applied globally.

Customizations.title: Javascript
Customizations.content: Insert here the custom Javascript or JQuery code, it will be applied globally.

Social.title: Social channels
Social.content: Insert here the links to your social channels.

APIs.title: Google Maps Key
APIs.content: Insert here your Google Maps Key. The key is required to make the maps work. Please see the documentation for instructions and more details.

APIs.title: Google Analytics ID
APIs.content: Insert here your Google Analytics Tracking ID (ex. UA-000000-2) to start monitoring you site traffic through Google Analytics.

APIs.title: SMTP email
APIs.content: Insert here your SMTP server information if you want the Contact Form component to send the emails through it. You can retrive this information at your hosting documentation. The default port is 465.

APIs.title: reCaptcha
APIs.content: Insert here your reCapthca V3 keys if you want to use the Google reCaptcha system with the Contact Form component.

System requirements.title: System requirements
System requirements.content: These are the recommended minimum requirements of your hosting and site. Do not worry if something is red, but if anything on the website do not work as expected the red items could be the issue.
